thread.title: Shane Edwards to miss three weeks with fractured leg suffered against Carlton |
thread.title_full: Shane Edwards to miss three weeks with fractured leg suffered against Carlton | The Advertiser

author: Jay Clark
title: Shane Edwards to miss three weeks with fractured leg suffered against Carlton |
text:
RICHMOND will be without midfielder Shane Edwards for the most difficult part of its season after scans on Saturday revealed he had fractured his leg.
Edwards is expected to miss three matches with a hairline crack in his right fibula.
While Richmond was relieved the speedy ball-winner had not broken his leg and required a more lengthy layoff, Edwards will be missing for next week’s clash against St Kilda, followed by more testing assignments against Fremantle and Hawthorn at the MCG.
The Tigers can embed themselves in the top-four over the next month after joining fourth-placed Hawthorn on 36 points witha win over Carlton on Friday night.
Richmond big man Tyrone Vickery is also in danger of being suspended by the match review panel after making head contact with Blues’ defender Michael Jamison in the first term of the 30-point triumph.
Shane Edwards ended the game on crutches. Picture: Getty Source: Getty Images
Vickery was attempting to block Jamison with a hip and shoulder when their heads collided, ending Jamison’s night early with suspected concussion.
Jamison is in doubt for Carlton’s clash against Fremantle on Saturday night, while utility Dennis Armfield will have scans to assess a suspected broken arm.
Gun midfielders Bryce Gibbs (shoulder) and Marc Murphy (soreness) will also be assessed.
Tiger Edwards, 26, went down in the third term and required crutches to leave the MCG, spreading fears he could be finished for the season.
But Edwards is slated to return in the Round 19 clash against Collingwood, giving him five matches to tune-up for finals.
Bump or block? If bump, Ty Vickery could face the Match Review Panel 0:49 Play video
AFL: It looked innocuous at the time, but Carlton's Michael Jamison was temporarily subbed off under the concussion rule after this encounter with Richmond's Ty Vickery. Will Vickery come under the Match Review Panel scrutiny?
Fox Sports 10 Jul 2015 Sport/AFL/News After finishing fourth in the best and fairest last year, Edwards had again made an excellent start to this season, averaging 21 possessions, four tackles and four clearances and almost one goal a game before this round.
His absence could open up a door for tough midfielder Matt Thomas who had 27 possessions, nine clearances and 11 tackles in the VFL yesterday, or classy second-year utility Ben Lennon, who had 25 disposals.
Ruckman Ivan Maric is also due back to return from suspension against the Saints, although back-up big man Shaun Hampson performed well against the Blues.
Originally published as Fractured leg halts Tiger Edwards’ season
